ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic triad of cleft palate, intellectual disability, and developmental delay. Most common genetic cause of cleft palate with ID.
Frequently presents with cleft palate (35-40% of cases), intellectual disability, and global developmental delay.
X-linked form of Kabuki syndrome with similar features including cleft palate, ID, and developmental delay.
Cleft palate is common (30-40%), though intellectual disability is less typical unless with complications.
Features include cleft palate (30% of cases), severe intellectual disability, and global developmental delay.
Most common syndromic cause of cleft palate, though intellectual disability is not typical without other complications.
X-linked disorder with cleft palate, intellectual disability, and developmental delays as common features.
Features intellectual disability and developmental delay; cleft palate occurs in 20-30% of cases.
